info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Broadwater, south central Meagher, Madison, southern Beaverhead, southeastern Jefferson and Gallatin Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong Thunderstorms across Southwestern Montana. Some of these storms were located along a line from Interstate 15 between Three Forks and Bozeman to near Dillon, and the storms are moving East at around 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Dillon, Sheridan, Virginia City, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Whitehall, Ennis, Twin Bridges, Lima, Pony, Monida, Alder, Silver Star, Toston, Harrison, Big Sky, Bannack Pass and Targhee Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
